2. Battle of Villalar (1521) - Castilian forces, under the command of Charles V, defeated the Revolt of the Comuneros, a rebellion against the king's taxation policies.

4. Battle of Alcácer Quibir (1578) - A Castilian-Portuguese army, led by King Sebastian of Portugal, was defeated by the forces of Sultan Ahmad al-Mansur of Morocco, resulting in the death of King Sebastian and the loss of Portuguese independence to Spain.

5. Battle of Bailén (1808) - Castilian forces, led by General Francisco Castaños, defeated a French army under General Pierre Dupont during the Peninsular War, marking the first significant defeat by French forces in a major battle since the Napoleonic Wars began.

6. Battle of San Marcial (1813) - Castilian forces, fighting alongside British and Portuguese soldiers, defeated French forces during the Peninsular War, leading to the end of French occupation of Spain.
